result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale Booker Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to any current sentence serving

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay mandatory surcharge. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges from 25% of prison funds to be collected by DOC's. Pay restitution in the amout of $ZERO. A payment plan for all monetary obligations is to be established by DOC's, Probation and Parole. All unpaid monetary balances at the end of said period will convert to a civil judgment. Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the State of Wisconsin department of correction.
- Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession, consumption, selling, distributing of illegal drugs, alcohol.
- Random urine screens; if deemed appropriate.
- No contact with victim, Alexander C., or roommate Rene A.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale Booker Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant regarding DNA surcharge.

Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.    Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Original Transcript (24 pages) commencing PLEA and SENTENCING HEARING JUNE 30, 2014 received and filed.CB
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

Attorney Christopher M Glinski in court, defendant Dale Booker not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
At the request of defendant's counsel, and with the agreement of all parties, plea and sentencing is adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher M Glinski in court, defendant Dale Booker not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-04-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dale Booker in court with attorney Christopher M Glinski.  Defendant Dale Booker in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NEO B. AND ALEXANDER C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dale Booker in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Dale Booker in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
